v.v: After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed the day he was born.
He said,
“May the day on which I was born perish,
May that day be dark;
May darkness and the shadow of death claim it for their own.
As for that night, may thick darkness seize it.
See, may that night be barren;
May they curse that day,
May the stars of that day’s dawn be dark.
because it did not shut up the doors of my mother’s womb,
Why did I not die when I came out from the womb?
Why did her knees welcome me?
For now I would have been lying down quietly.
with kings and counselors of the earth,
Or I would have been lying with princes who once had gold,
Or perhaps I would have been stillborn,
There the wicked cease from trouble;
There the prisoners are at ease together;
Both small and great people are there;
Why is light given to him who is in misery?
to one who longs for death without it coming;
Why is light given to one who rejoices very much
Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden,
For my sighing happens instead of eating;
For the thing that I feared has come on me;
I am not at ease, I am not quiet, and I have no rest;

v: the night that said, ‘A boy has been conceived.’
may not God from above call it to mind,
neither may the sun shine on it.
May a cloud live over it;
may everything that makes the day black truly terrify it.
May it not rejoice among the days of the year;
may it not come into the number of the months.
may no joyful voice come into it.
those who know how to wake up Leviathan.
May that day look for light, but find none;
neither may it see the eyelids of the dawn,
and because it did not hide trouble from my eyes.
Why did I not give up my spirit when my mother bore me?
Why did her breasts receive me so that I should suck?
I would have slept and been at rest
who built up tombs for themselves that are now in ruins.
who had filled their houses with silver.
like infants that never see the light.
there the weary are at rest.
they do not hear the voice of the slave driver.
the servant is free from his master there.
Why is life given to the one who is bitter in soul,
to one who digs for death more than for hidden treasure?
and is glad when he finds the grave?
a man whom God has hedged in?
my groaning is poured out like water.
what I was afraid of has come to me.
trouble comes instead.”
